Job Title: Sr. Solution Architect, SAP Sales and Distribution
Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

Moderna is seeking a Digital Senior Solution Architect, SAP Sales and Distribution, who will be based out of our Norwood office. In this role, you will take pride in staying on top of the latest technology trends while delivering innovative and transformative Digital solutions Commercial Operations.  Candidates will excel in this role are able to understand the complex challenges of global Order to Cash (OTC) processes while marrying system capabilities to meet those needs.

This role will be the key Solution Architect for the Digital Order to Cash organization. The individual will collaborate with Commercial, Finance, Manufacturing and Supply Chain to implement processes, technical solutions, and continuous improvement using SAP S/4HANA and a variety of Commercial applications. In addition, this role will collaborate with digital and commercial colleagues to establish foundational processes while building an innovative roadmap.

We are looking for a candidate who can deliver and be part of a modern, world class portfolio of digital innovations in the Commercial space, and who is excited to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious and Collaborative.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Serve as an SAP Order to Cash functional expert to the Personal Cancer Vaccine (PCV) team. You will use your experience in defining, designing, and configuration across SAP Sales & Distribution functional areas

  • Collaborate with business users to understand business requirements to understand key business goals and translate those to SAP Solutions.

  • Define project Scope and develop project plan to includes, project implementation estimates of time frames, quality and quantity of resources required, RAID to successfully implement project.

  • Contribute to solution design, configuration/development, documentation, training, troubleshooting, and support activities.

  • Build strong relationships with your peers in the Digital Organization, business stakeholders, and technology/service partners.

  • Design enhancements to SAP standard solution or new custom solution, and work with developers to implement the solution.

  • Provide ongoing continuous improvements consultation to business stakeholders and advisors

  • Stay current with and adopt new tools and applications to ensure high quality and efficient solutions while proposing to leadership ideas to keep us innovating and remaining relevant.

  • Provide clear documentation for delivered solutions and processes, integrating documentation with the appropriate corporate stakeholders.

  • Additional duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • Bachelor’s degree with 7 years of hands-on Consulting or Industry Experience; a combination of education and experience may be considered

  • Minimum of 3- 4 SAP end to end implementation projects experience

  • Demonstrated performance as SAP Sales & Distribution Solution Architect

  • Hands on Experience in configuring and deploying Sales & Billing solutions, Intercompany, Pricing, Make to Order, variant configuration, 3PL/4PL Integration

  • Well acquainted in integration with other modules like FI/ CO/ IM/WM/ MM/PP, APO

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Experience delivering projects using Agile Methodology

  • SAP S/4HANA experience

  • Proficiency with SAP and non-SAP integration with EDI, Manufacturing and logistics/XPS systems

  • Hands on experience with SD integration with batch management, Sample management, Make to order manufacturing processes

  • Ability to understand business requirements, manage user stories and define, document, design & deliver SAP Configurations, and functional specifications.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate with business and technical people alike.

  • Excellent project management, analytical, communication and inter-personal skills

  • Quick learner. Demonstrate initiative and ownership.

  • SAP certification preferred.

  • Experience working with Pharmaceutical, Life Science, or highly regulated industry preferred.

  • Project management skills with the ability to prioritize and multi-task activities in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and simultaneously organize work across multiple projects.

  • Be comfortable with ambiguity and a fast-paced, highly dynamic, entrepreneurial environment.

  • Be self-driven, willing to collaborate, think creatively, and drive tasks to completion with minimal oversight.

  • Self-directed with effective analytical and problem-solving skills.  Must be able to drive results on multiple complex assignments simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

The Role

Moderna is seeking a team of experienced Regional Account Managers to support the commercialization of Moderna’s groundbreaking vaccine portfolio.  In this role, you will be joining Moderna at both an exciting, as well as critical time as we commercialize our respiratory vaccine pipeline.

Reporting to a Senior Director, Regional Account Management you be responsible for developing and enhancing customer relationships with largest vaccinators throughout your region. This includes Regional Health Systems, State Awardees/VFC, Federally Qualified Health Centers, Contracting Entities, Physician Groups and Specialty Providers. You will develop expert knowledge of Moderna’s respiratory vaccine portfolio/mRNA platform and use this along with your knowledge of strategic customer requirements to expand vaccination rates and achieve account sales targets.

To be successful, you must thrive in a fast-paced, team environment and excel at developing high-level customer relationships with the procurement, business development, clinical, operational, trade management, and marketing teams within your region’s largest providers of health care services.

This role is based remotely.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Develop strategic account plans that will enhance customer relationships, achieve sales targets, facilitate retention and growth within key customers (IDNs, Health Systems, FQHCs, Awardees, Physician Groups, Contracting Entities, etc) to support and oversee successful communication and negotiation

  • Act as the primary point of contact for Moderna for a defined set of accounts, analyzing and understanding sales trends for product sales to each account, achieving defined goals and objectives, developing expert knowledge of the products offered by the company to ensure an excellent understanding of the customer requirements and promoting a mutually beneficial business relationship while adhering to Moderna Core Values and Mindsets

  • Work with your Sr. Director, within channels to establish & execute tactical initiatives reflected in dedicated business plans, which align with the business unit objectives.

  • Analyze account objectives for each product and develop strategic/tactical plans to accomplish brand business objectives

  • Develop and maintain contacts within the industry to obtain environmental, competitive, and product-specific information

  • Build and maintain long-term relationships within defined customer bases to ensure customer alignment and create a foundation for new business

  • Collaborate and partner with internal and external stakeholders to enhance Moderna’s position in the market

  • Responsible for cultivating a close relationship with cross functional team colleagues in Medical Affairs, Marketing, Distribution / Logistics, Strategic Partnerships, Customer Service, and Public Affairs departments to implement corporate, operational (shipping/inventory), market access and brand specific strategies and tactics

  • Represent Moderna at key trade and customer meetings / conferences.

  • Promote Moderna portfolio of products to key customers that drives differentiation for Moderna and successful long-term business relationships

  • Collaborate with appropriate Moderna business teams, marketing, and medical affairs to ensure alignment and full utilization of resources at account level. This includes utilization of marketing materials, execution of in-services, development, and execution of marketing or other service agreements

  • Liaise with Contracts, Customer Operations, Legal, HR, and Finance to ensure successful outcomes for the responsible channels.

  • Bachelor’s Degree required

  • Minimum 10 years of experience in pharmaceutical/biotech account strategy and account management

  • Prior experience in vaccines is highly preferred

  • Knowledge and understanding of product reimbursement

  • Demonstrated prior experience with establishing and consistently meeting or exceeding business development targets

  • Experience in a startup environment, preferably launching new vaccines or medicines

  • Experience working with complex Academic Medical Centers & teaching hospitals

  • Working Knowledge of capitated and risk-based providers and fundamentals of value-based care

  • Demonstrated track record of building and driving volume and profitable revenue growth with key corporate or private sector accounts

  • Ability to collaborate among a range of key areas (marketing, field team, communications, promotion, physician, trade and consumer channels, pricing and contracting, and/or buyers).

  • Strong portfolio of commercial skills obtained through experience and application with track record of delivery including negotiation, building a financial business case & working within commercial teams.

  • Must be comfortable with ambiguity and a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment that is being defined in real-time. You should be driven and willing to think creatively and pursue new or novel approaches to business and market development. The fast-moving market for vaccines will require a high degree of adaptability and trust building with key accounts

Job Description

The Role

Moderna is seeking a Sr. Director, Marketing – RSV, whose primary role is to plan, develop, execute and optimize multi-channel brand strategies and plans for RSV in the United States market. This individual works closely with the global brand marketing teams, internal support functions and executive leadership to manage all phases of execution for integrated multi-channel plans. The Sr. Director also plays a key role in generating insights to drive ongoing optimization of brand campaigns and continual alignment of plans and strategies with brand objectives, goals and budgets.

In this role, you will join Moderna at a critical time for Moderna and their product pipeline.  This role will be responsible for preparing and executing “best in class” brand plans, manage launch excellence, develop strategies and tactics as well as work closely with the global marketing teams.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Be the strategic brand expert who drives Moderna’s commercial brand strategy for RSV within the US

  • Develop comprehensive and innovative annual Brand plan for the US that supports commercial brand positioning, brand narrative, disease awareness and thought leadership for marketed brands and pipeline assets

  • Shape the key elements that define Moderna’s position as a leader in the US vaccines market, working closely with the US Head of Marketing and global brand team

  • Work effectively within the commercial function, across the brands and with market access to ensure consistent strategic and tactical implementation of global communication programs and initiatives to support the global commercial brand strategies

  • Collaborate with the commercial, medical, and regulatory teams at every stage of development through launch, navigating the complexities inherent in rapid response vaccine development. You’ll work with a multitude of internal and external stakeholders to drive a smooth and successful product launch(s)

  • Ensure clear engagement plans and roadmaps for US stakeholders across functions are aligned to brand strategies

  • Support field (and partner) needs including brand training and best in class tactical tools for engagement with customers in face to face and remote/digital settings

  • Partner with the global brand team, lead US implementation of core media and digital campaigns for optimal use, brand recognition, and ROI

  • Provide strong project management/leadership on key communications activities and initiatives, ensuring they are completed on time with a high level of quality, in accordance with Compliance, Chief Medical Office, Legal and Regulatory requirements

  • Bring your relentless drive and ambition for excellence to assess and define the key value drivers, brand narrative, and go-to-market strategy across a multichannel approach for a complex ecosystem of healthcare providers, governments, health systems, and health care consumers

  • Additional duties as may be assigned from time to time

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • Bachelor’s degree required

  • Minimum 12 years of experience in vaccines/pharmaceuticals brand management and/or customer facing roles

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Understanding of and strong interest in vaccines/infectious disease

  • Demonstrated experience using innovative digital channels and platforms for communications.

  • Savvy and comfortable making recommendations using different digital channels and platforms

  • Able to translate complex scientific information into clear, concise language, understandable by all audiences, both verbally and in writing

  • Proven ability and hands-on experience navigating complex product communications issues

  • Knowledgeable in current and evolving communications tactics and channels, including utilizing communications technology such as podcasts, intranets and internal and external social networks

  • Thinks strategically, prioritizes effectively and delivers high-impact results

  • Exceptional project management experience, including managing several programs/ projects simultaneously

  • Strong business acumen and robust understanding of regulatory requirements as they relate to marketing programs and initiatives

  • Collaborative leadership skills to influence without authority and work effectively with senior leadership

  • Ability to take initiative and work independently and is comfortable with ambiguity

  • Effectively negotiates and collaborates with stakeholders; demonstrates the ability to resolve conflict in a constructive manner

  • Strong and respectful interpersonal and partnering skills, and the ability to build meaningful and sustainable relationships at all levels and functions of the organization

  • A dynamic and positive team player with excellent organizational, influencing, presentation and written communications skills

  • Solution-oriented, demonstrates quick analysis, thoughtful and ethical judgment, and rapid response on corporate reputational topics and issues, including ability to convincingly articulate the company’s position internally and externally

  • Pragmatic and willing to drive and support change

  • Ability to seek diverse input from multiple constituents and stakeholders to drive decisions and innovative solutions

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

Job Title: Consumer Marketing Lead, Older Adult - US
Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

Moderna is at the vanguard of messenger RNA (mRNA) therapeutics, and we are in search of an accomplished Director of Consumer Marketing – Older Adults to join our US Commercial team. This pivotal role entails crafting and executing groundbreaking consumer marketing strategies for our respiratory portfolio, with a focus on patient-centric initiatives. Your strategic vision will shape market activities that are instrumental in achieving commercial success. Working collaboratively with cross-functional partners, you will be the driving force behind campaigns that not only resonate with patients but also reinforce Moderna's commitment to delivering revolutionary therapies.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Develop and lead the execution of the older adult strategy within the consumer segment for the US Commercial organization.

  • Conduct comprehensive market research and analysis to understand the pharmaceutical consumer landscape, including patient demographics and behaviors, market trends, and competitor strategies.

  • Translate insights into action through comprehensive and innovative plans to drive vaccination rates within the older adult population.

  • Develop and manage robust brand strategies for our pharmaceutical products, establishing strong brand identities and messaging.

  • Create and manage educational campaigns to raise consumer awareness about diseases, treatments, and the benefits of Moderna's products, ensuring high levels of consumer engagement.

  • Maintain strict adherence to regulatory compliance, ensuring all marketing efforts align with industry regulations and ethical standards.

  • Lead cross-functional collaboration to ensure marketing strategies are integrated with broader business objectives.

  • Oversee the US Commercial consumer marketing budget for Older Adults, effectively allocating resources and assessing the ROI of marketing initiatives.

  • Utilize digital marketing channels to enhance consumer reach and engagement.

  • Plan and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns, including advertising, promotions, and events to drive product awareness and consumer demand.

  • Employ data analytics to inform and refine marketing strategies based on consumer behavior insights.

  • Engage with external stakeholders to build advocacy and support for Moderna's products.

  • Coordinate the consumer marketing elements for new product launches, ensuring a successful market introduction and sustained support.

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • A minimum of 10 years of marketing experience, with a preference for substantial experience in the pharmaceutical or biotech industries.

  • A Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.

  • Demonstrated proficiency in content development, campaign management, and strategic optimization based on data analytics.

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • A strong interest in vaccines and infectious diseases, with the ability to translate complex scientific information into accessible language.

  • A track record of success in consumer marketing within the pharmaceutical or biotech sector.

  • Robust understanding of the healthcare ecosystem.

  • Expertise in brand management and the development of impactful marketing campaigns.

  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data-driven decision making.

  • Exceptional leadership abilities and experience in team management.

  • A deep understanding of regulatory compliance in pharmaceutical marketing.

  • Proficiency in digital marketing strategies and tools.

  • Experience in managing budgets and measuring marketing ROI.

  • Demonstrated success in new product launches and market introduction strategies.

  • A commitment to driving and supporting change, with a solution-oriented mindset.

  • An inclusive approach to decision-making, valuing diverse input and innovative solutions.

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role:

The Head of US Commercial Finance will serve as the finance business partner to the US Commercial Organization, providing financial and business insights, guidance, and decision support. This role is critical as Moderna builds its commercial model and expands its product lines with 15 launches planned over the next 5 years. The Head of Finance US Commercial will lead financial advising and reporting for the US Commercial organization, enabling optimal resource allocation through complex financial analysis, detailed sales analytics, and pricing and reimbursement modeling. This role also coordinates and executes the Long Range Plan, Annual Budget, monthly and quarterly forecasting, and reporting activities for timely and accurate consolidation into corporate reporting requirements.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

  • Serve as a strategic partner to the US Commercial Organization, providing insights, reporting, and analytics to support key decisions and develop long-term business plans. This includes acting as a functional champion in Moderna’s strategic Long Range Planning (LRP) process, where a data-centric approach is crucial for aligning digital efforts with business priorities.

  • Partner with the business to drive ROI analysis, manage the entire planning cycle including Budget, LRP, and monthly / quarterly forecasting, using a dynamic range approach to drive both strategic and operational objectives.

  • Manage the P&L for the US market closely with commercial partners, including revenue and operating expense forecasting and managing risks and opportunities, while pushing past possible to address and overcome challenges proactively.

  • Develop strategy in collaboration with the business, including pricing dynamics, and act as a bridge between the US team and corporate team, removing viscosity to foster smoother inter-departmental collaboration.

  • Lead the monthly US revenue forecasting process, providing performance statistics to the leadership team and collaborating with sales leadership and operations to deliver regular updates on expected performance.

  • Ensure monthly results are well-understood and aligned with forecasts, providing accounting guidance as needed, and obsessing over learning to continually improve financial accuracy and insight.

  • Provide financial leadership for growth initiatives, customer development, sales performance incentives, and product development opportunities, enabling the team to question convention and explore innovative approaches to commercial finance.

  • Proactively deliver insightful analysis on revenue and profitability by assessing trends in product, geography, price, and customer mix, and pivot fearlessly in response to new data to optimize financial strategies.

  • Work with leaders in Accounting, Market Access, Contract Operations, Sales, Commercial Analytics, and Marketing to create advanced financial analysis and reporting while effectively interpreting and communicating recommendations.

  • Understand and appropriately forecast all gross to net impacts in close partnership with Accounting and Commercial teams.

  • Work cross-functionally to understand vaccination rates and go-to-market strategies across multiple channels and patient segments.

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

Basic Qualifications:

  • 12+ years of relevant FP&A experience with 5+ years of Biotech/Pharmaceutical Commercial FP&A required.

  • Experience launching and tracking performance for launch brands.

  • Bachelor’s degree required.

  • Experience working cross-functionally with brand marketing, commercial operations, and sales.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • MBA and/or CPA preferred.

  • Ability to lead and influence beyond finance to drive significant impacts for Moderna US

  • Strong business acumen: proven ability to effectively scrutinize and challenge assumptions and interpret the strategy and priorities of the organization in financial terms.

  • Excellent project management / leadership skills with demonstrated track record and ability to engage teams to work together towards common deadlines.

  • Strong presentation skills to deliver succinctly and effectively deliver recommendations to senior leaders and frame complex concepts.

  • Prior experience working in a US matrixed environment; experience coordinating processes and delivering results collaboratively.

  • Skilled in decision-making, conflict resolution, and fostering a collaborative team environment.

  • Demonstrated track record of successful people management, including hiring, developing, and retaining high-performing teams.

  • Experience with performance management, including setting objectives, conducting performance reviews, and managing team dynamics while fostering a culture of belonging and inclusion.

  • Proven ability to lead, coach, and mentor individuals and teams to enhance their capabilities and support career growth.

  • Flexibility and ability to adapt to changing conditions and different cultures.

  • Exceptional attitude, attention to detail and ability to motivate teams to do the same.

  • Understanding of market dynamics and the pricing and reimbursement environment

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

Moderna is at the vanguard of messenger RNA (mRNA) therapeutics, and we are in search of an accomplished Director of Consumer Marketing – Adult to join our US Commercial team. This pivotal role entails crafting and executing groundbreaking consumer marketing strategies for our respiratory portfolio, with a focus on patient-centric initiatives. Your strategic vision will shape market activities that are instrumental in achieving commercial success. Working collaboratively with cross-functional partners, you will be the driving force behind campaigns that not only resonate with patients but also reinforce Moderna's commitment to delivering revolutionary therapies.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Develop and lead the execution of the Adult strategy within the consumer segment for the US Commercial organization.

  • Conduct comprehensive market research and analysis to understand the pharmaceutical consumer landscape, including patient demographics and behaviors, market trends, and competitor strategies.

  • Translate insights into action through comprehensive and innovative plans to drive vaccination rates within adult population.

  • Develop and manage robust brand strategies for our pharmaceutical products, establishing strong brand identities and messaging.

  • Create and manage educational campaigns to raise consumer awareness about diseases, treatments, and the benefits of Moderna's products, ensuring high levels of consumer engagement.

  • Maintain strict adherence to regulatory compliance, ensuring all marketing efforts align with industry regulations and ethical standards.

  • Lead cross-functional collaboration to ensure marketing strategies are integrated with broader business objectives.

  • Oversee the US Commercial consumer marketing budget for Adult, effectively allocating resources and assessing the ROI of marketing initiatives.

  • Utilize digital marketing channels to enhance consumer reach and engagement.

  • Plan and execute comprehensive marketing campaigns, including advertising, promotions, and events to drive product awareness and consumer demand.

  • Employ data analytics to inform and refine marketing strategies based on consumer behavior insights.

  • Engage with external stakeholders to build advocacy and support for Moderna's products.

  • Coordinate the consumer marketing elements for new product launches, ensuring a successful market introduction and sustained support.

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • A minimum of 10 years of marketing experience, with a preference for substantial experience in the pharmaceutical or biotech industries.

  • A Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.

  • Demonstrated proficiency in content development, campaign management, and strategic optimization based on data analytics.

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • A strong interest in vaccines and infectious diseases, with the ability to translate complex scientific information into accessible language.

  • A track record of success in consumer marketing within the pharmaceutical or biotech sector.

  • Robust understanding of the healthcare ecosystem.

  • Expertise in brand management and the development of impactful marketing campaigns.

  • Strong analytical skills and experience with data-driven decision making.

  • Exceptional leadership abilities and experience in team management.

  • A deep understanding of regulatory compliance in pharmaceutical marketing.

  • Proficiency in digital marketing strategies and tools.

  • Experience in managing budgets and measuring marketing ROI.

  • Demonstrated success in new product launches and market introduction strategies.

  • A commitment to driving and supporting change, with a solution-oriented mindset.

  • An inclusive approach to decision-making, valuing diverse input and innovative solutions.

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role:

Moderna is seeking an Associate Director of Clinical Operations to manage studies within the Oncology Therapeutic Area. This may include more than one study. This position will be responsible for initiating and leading clinical trials across all phases, including overseeing CROs and vendors and working cross-functionally on clinical operations strategy and related initiatives. This position reports to the Director, Clinical Operations. This position will work collaboratively across the therapeutic area and cross-functional teams on the overall development programs and related studies to ensure successful execution of assigned projects.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

  • Accountable for delivery of assigned clinical study budget, timelines, and resource management with focus on quality, including making recommendations and decisions regarding operational strategies to support study and/or program objectives

  • Develop operational strategy and clinical operations plans in support of execution of the Clinical Development Plan

  • Partner and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders such as the Project Leader, Clinical Lead and other relevant stakeholders

  • Lead and oversee execution of first-in-human through phase 4 trials, depending on lifecycle of program, in compliance with ICH/GCP, local regulations, and Moderna SOPs

  • Manage invoice and budget tracking for individual studies and provide input into budget forecasting activities

  • Support the selection, oversight, and management of CROs and other vendors

  • Oversee site feasibility/capability assessments in collaboration with the CRO and cross-functional team

  • Review and provide clinical operations input into relevant clinical documents such as the protocol, investigator brochure, regulatory documents, clinical study reports and other documents and plans as appropriate

  • Manage the cross functional team and CRO/vendor(s) related to all aspects of clinical trial operations

  • Responsible for representing Clinical Operations on cross-functional project teams and vendor/CRO operational meetings and ensuring compliance with operational standards and procedures

  • Along with other Clinical Development personnel, represent Moderna externally to Investigators, site staff, and Key Opinion Leaders

  • Perform and document study level Sponsor Oversight of outsourced clinical activities

  • Communicate study-status, cost and issues to ensure timely decision-making by senior management

  • Manage invoice and budget tracking for individual studies and provide input into monthly and annual forecasting activities for studies and programs

  • Oversee/collaborate on and contribute to inspection readiness activities that support audits and regulatory inspections related to clinical trial conduct

  • Maintain oversight and participate in the creation/review/training/maintenance of departmental and organizational SOPs to ensure compliance

  • Lead and/or participate in clinical operations workstreams related to departmental and operating model related initiatives

  • Develop and foster strong, collaborative relationships with key stakeholders both within and external to Moderna

  • Support program level deliverables/activities at the discretion of the Senior Director, Clinical Operations

  • Provide oversight and mentorship to assigned Clinical Trial Managers and Clinical Trial Associates by providing clinical operations and functional area expertise

  • Strive for continuous improvement and more efficient ways of working in clinical development

  • Act as a role model for Moderna’s values

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

  • Minimum of BA/BS with at least 8-10 years of trial and clinical program experience, including at least 4 years of independent clinical trial management experience and full trial life cycle experience (e.g., start-up, conduct, closure). Advanced degree preferred.

  • Robust experience in oncology required. Experience in early clinical development and immuno-oncology desirable. Experience in hematologic malignancies desirable.

  • Multi-dimensional Clinical Operations background with capability of devising plans for operational challenges such as site activation, subject enrollment, monitoring oversight, protocol deviation management, data cleaning, etc.

  • Cross-Collaboration proficiency with other functions such as Regulatory, CMC, Biostatistics, Data Management, Finance, Program Management, etc.

  • Experience in GCP inspections/audits

  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, in addition to excellent organizational skills

  • Proven track record of effective leadership and team-building skills in the context of a multi-disciplinary team in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry

  • Resilient, Creative, capable problem-solver

  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to work independently

  • Experience in establishing and maintaining relationships with key opinion leaders

  • Some travel required

Job Title: Sr. Director, Digital Portfolio and Strategic Operations
Job Description:
Job Description

The Role:

Reporting to the Chief Information Officer (CIO), the Senior Director of Digital Operations and Strategic Portfolio Management will serve as a pivotal 'force multiplier' within Moderna, driving the execution of strategic digital initiatives and ensuring alignment with the broader operational priorities of the company.

Situated at the core of the leadership team, this role is responsible for the operational delivery of Moderna's Digital Agenda, enabling the CIO to concentrate on primary objectives while effectively managing digital strategy, operations, and talent. The position demands a data-centric approach to portfolio leadership, focusing on leveraging operational insights to drive strategic initiatives and ensure their alignment with the company's mission.

This role will own and drive strategic cross-functional programs requiring diligent project management to facilitate change within the digital organization—and across the company. Successful execution in this role combines leadership, strategy, operations, and delivery. Based in our new state-of-the-art, LEED-certified headquarters in Cambridge, MA, this position requires onsite presence >70% of the time with up to 30% flexibility to work from home. Role requires travel up to 20%, primarily to Seattle, WA.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

Data-Driven Strategy:

  • Act as a functional champion as part of Moderna’s strategic Long Range Planning (LRP) process, integrating data analytics to align digital efforts with business priorities and corporate goals, demonstrating our act with urgency mindset to capitalize on strategic opportunities.

  • Formulate and manage a data-centric business investment strategy that underpins business decisions with robust analysis of value and risk, reflecting a push past possible mindset to transcend traditional strategic limitations.

  • Navigate and influence the digital operations strategy within a matrixed organization using data as the cornerstone for decision-making, applying our remove viscosity mindset to ensure smooth and effective decision flows.

  • Reconcile competing digital priorities by leveraging data insights, ensuring cohesion with Moderna's broader strategic imperatives, and employing a pivot fearlessly approach to adapt strategies as needed.

Operational Execution:

  • Drive functional and cross-functional strategic digital initiatives, grounded in data and aligned with the company's mission and vision, embodying the behave like owners principle.

  • Lead program management and organizational change within the digital operations domain, advocating for data-driven methodologies and the integration of advanced analytics, showcasing an obsess over learning dedication to continual improvement.

  • Propel digital operations and strategic portfolio management with a focus on delivery, innovation, operational analytics, and strategic congruence, continuously questioning convention to enhance operational effectiveness.

  • Partner cross-functionally with other functional portfolio leaders across Moderna to increase communication, share best practices, and create consistent approaches to portfolio/PMO management, fostering a collaborative environment.

Operations Management:

  • In alignment with the CIO and Digital Leadership Team, articulate a clear digital strategy vision and roadmap, supported by data analytics to monitor progress and achieve strategic targets.

  • Manage the financial aspects of digital projects with a data-driven approach to budgeting, cost control, and value realization (ROI).

  • Develop an operational data platform that serves as the engine for communicating organizational progress and informed decision-making.

  • Establish and maintain data-driven KPIs and dashboards to measure, report, and enhance digital operations performance.

  • Facilitate regular data-driven leadership meetings to ensure the digital operations model remains in sync with strategic initiatives.

  • Create and own simple yet effective governance standards, utilizing data to ensure compliance and effective risk management.

People Leadership:

  • Lead a small, ambitious team to ensure both the strategic and portfolio/PMO needs of the Digital organization are met.

  • Create a culture of belonging, development, and innovation that brings out the best in each team member and creates space and opportunity for growth.

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

Basic Requirements:

  • BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field.

  • 10+ years of experience in digital operations or IT management, with a demonstrated track record in digital strategy execution and portfolio management.

  • Proven experience in leading digital transformation and managing large-scale technology projects.

Preferred Requirements:

  • Advanced degree (MA/MS/MBA) in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.

  • Exceptional leadership skills with the ability to foster a culture of innovation and manage change within a dynamic environment.

  • Strong analytical and strategic planning capabilities, coupled with solid financial acumen.

  • Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies, including agile practices.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the capacity to engage effectively with a diverse range of teams and stakeholders.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

In this role, the Sr. Manager, Logistics Engineering will ensure development, deployment, monitoring, governance and continual improvement of cold chain, supply chain visibility and secondary distribution requirements across the Moderna organization.   He/She will ensure that Moderna pre-clinical, clinical, and commercial products complies with relevant cold chain and GDP best practices, guidance, and regulations. He/She will Assist in the deployment of end-to-end cold chain and distribution procedures and guidelines that will ensure compliance and meet business needs. He/She will act as the key SME for supply chain visibility projects and enhancements that lead to a world class customer experience for internal and external stakeholders.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Deploy, enhance, maintain, and oversee implementation of Moderna’s Logistics Engineering program, strategy, requirements, and milestones. Act as a core member for Moderna’s Cold Chain cross functional team.

  • Act as an owner for Logistics Engineering / Supply Chain visibility projects (i.e. real time and temperature tracking, digital twins and IoT analytics)

  • Provide expert advice to Moderna’s various business units and staff on the handling, storage, and visibility of cold chain products according to current best practices, guidelines, and regulations.

  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders such as Manufacturing, Distribution/Logistics, and Quality to support new shipping system implementation activities at internal and external sites.

  • Support technical transfer Distribution and Cold Chain operations at CMO and 3PL sites including the handling, storage, and visibility of cold chain products.

  • Provide training on cold chain and supply chain visibility  best practices, guidelines, and regulations across departments.

  • Provide subject matter expert support during Good Manufacturing Practices/Good Distribution Practices audits, regulatory agency inspections.

  • Develop cold chain monitoring and controls to assess the application of measures to meet compliance requirements and mitigate risks.

  • Interact and liaise with External Quality for the qualification of vendors and service providers such as Freight Forwarders, Carriers, etc. including developing of Standard Operational Procedures (SOP), Quality Agreements and SOWs.

  • Maintain current knowledge of relevant cold chain requirements and monitor emerging industry trends to determine potential impacts on Moderna to ensure that our practices, guideline, and procedures remain compliant and up to date.

  • Support Moderna’s mission and core values.

  • Additional duties as may be assigned from time to time

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • Education: University degree in technology, engineering, or related field.

  • Experience: 8-10 years (BA/BS) or 5-7 years (MS) in various Cold Chain, Supply Chain, Manufacturing & Science, and Logistics functions (strong preference towards Pharmaceutical and Biotech experience. Experience working in a cGMP environment).

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Experience and proficient knowledge of supply chain visibility platforms, IoT devices, AI, Machine Learning

  • Experience with managing Quality System events (Change Controls, CAPA’s, Deviations, etc)

  • Experience with creating GMP Documentation (SOP’s, Work Instructions, Policies, etc)

  • Experience and knowledge of cold chain technology, tools, and shipping qualification.

  • Other government agency regulatory experience relating to biotech manufacturing.

  • Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written) to collaborate with senior CMC Management in a dynamic, cross-functional matrix environment – you are outgoing, communicative, and seek to build relationships on a daily basis.

  • Well organized – a natural ability to be organized in how you think, communicate, and conduct your work.

  • You drive for results – you set a high bar for yourself and others. You love what you do, and it shows.

  • Ability to manage projects in a fast-paced environment.

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

Job Description

The Role:

Moderna is seeking a Clinical Supplies Sr. Project Manager to manage the clinical supplies needs across its projects, as well as, work with packaging and labeling and IRT vendors and CROs.  This position works collaboratively across several therapeutic area teams as well as cross functionally to support study needs.  This successful candidate will be skilled at understanding the needs of critical programs with attention to detail, with a collaborative outlook, and with the ability to manage workload and meet project timelines.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

  • Responsible for logistics as required to support the labeling, packaging and shipment of clinical drug supplies to depots/investigative sites as well as other clinical supplies as necessary

  • Participate in business review meetings with third party drug supply vendors

  • Responsible for IRT requirements, user acceptance testing, and management

  • Responsible for Clinical Supplies Planning and Forecasting as required to meet program objectives

  • Develop and compile KPIs (metrics)

  • Primary liaison for inventory control and distribution activities including scheduling, issue resolution, change implementation, vendor oversight and scope review related to clinical supplies

  • Manages/Works with third party vendors, Functional Leads and interface with CMC for Production Planning & Distribution; develops forecast of all drug supply needs and works with CMC department to ensure goals are met

  • Generates and reviews processes as required and ensures compliance to relevant SOPs

  • Implements Industry Best Practices and templates for clinical drug supply activities

  • Works with CMC and clinical group on Master Production Schedule so timing of clinical trial drug needs are met

  • Maintains collaborative relationships with third party vendors to assure the complete scope of planning activities remains connected with operations and compliant with quality requirements

  • Monitors and tracks shipments to ensure smooth transit through the logistical path –including international shipping

  • Responsible for coordinating and scheduling drug labeling and packaging activities in conjunction with CMC, clinical, regulatory departments

  • Oversee vendor activities including procurement, labeling performance, on-time delivery, quality, improvement initiatives and issue resolution

  • Develop pharmacy manual in conjunction with relevant cross functional leads

  • Develop drug supply training materials for investigational sites

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

  • At least 5 -8 years of clinical drug supply management/clinical supply chain/clinical supplies experience in a clinical research environment is preferred

  • Bachelor’s degree in a science-based subject

  • Prior Cold Chain packaging, labeling, distribution experience required

  • IRT design and management experience required.

  • Clinical Supplies Planning and Forecasting experience required

  • Experience with Clinical Supply Inventory Management systems required

  • Prior Biopharmaceutical, pharmaceutical or chemical manufacturing experience preferred

  • Creative, capable problem-solver

  • Experience in establishing and maintaining relationships with vendors and attending business review meetings (Vendor oversight)

  • Working knowledge of ICH, FDA, IRB/IEC and other applicable regulations/guidelines and demonstrated understanding of clinical research protocol requirements

  • Demonstrated proficiency with word processing, spreadsheet, database, presentation software (MS Office skills such as Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint)

  • Successful candidate will be curious in exploring new path for clinical research, bold in proposing creative solutions and ideas. Will work collaboratively with multifunctional teams and partners and will be relentless in pursuing successful outcomes

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

In this role, you will be responsible for managing a portion of the Daily Material Requirements Planning (MRP) of the materials within the Supply Chain Organization. This role will act as an end to end owner for a portfolio of purchased SKUs, ensuring a robust material supply plan is executed to support our global manufacturing network. This role will plan Raw Material Purchasing, BOM items, Non BOM Items, Critical Components, Consumables, Moderna Buy items, etc. per manufacturing demand and be able to create and present material planning analyses as needed for manufacturing readiness and inventory governance.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Execute MRP using SAP to plan raw material requirements weekly by defining appropriate MRP parameters, and executing requirements planning for both BOM driven and replenishment of all  planned materials

  • Manage open purchase orders with multiple vendors and accurately reflect status in SAP

  • Escalation of risk through management when identified and working through cross functional resolution of the issue. Working closely with vendor-facing partner teams to drive vendor resolution as required.

  • Problem solving MRP and purchasing issues with BOM owners, production planning, and manufacturing. Ultimately determining root cause and correcting MRP signals

  • Key team member to facilitate raw material projects and NPI, ensuring all demand changes are captured appropriately and material is introduced with one valid purchasing plan

  • Provide guidance to supply chain best practice in multi-site/CMO planning environment. Ensuring tactical raw material readiness for new projects as part of master project plan

  • Review updates to master production forecasts to assess raw material and budget impacts

  • Responsible for performance to material planning KPIs – including inventory target levels and safety stock adherence, on time quality release of incoming materials

  • Ad hoc data analysis for raw material planning as required

  • Additional duties as may be assigned from as required

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • BA in Supply Chain, Science, Engineering or Economics/Finance with at least 3-5 years’ experience

  • 3-5 years’ experience with SAP and MRP

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Demonstrated ability to collaborate across role boundaries and form effective working relationships with colleagues.

  • Demonstrated ability to work and adapt to change in a fast-paced environment i.e., ability to succeed with pivoting demand signals, changes to process in multi-level BOMs, vendor driven supply constraints. Ability to understanding and react to situations in a timely manner without always having the full story available

  • Experience building a business strategy at the same time as executing the day-to-day process

  • Customer and business focused – determined to deliver successful outcomes improving the business in a cost-effective way.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is a must

  • Well organized – a natural ability to be organized in how you think, communicate, and conduct your work

  • Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written) to effectively collaborate and communicate with senior CMC Management in a dynamic, cross-functional matrix environment – you are communicative, and seek to build relationships on a daily basis

  • Experience working with cGMP material suppliers is preferred

  • Experience with Tableau is a plus

  • A curious mindset that allows you to constantly learn and challenge the status quo

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

Job Description

The Role

In this role, you will be responsible for the development, implementation, and oversight of strategies and solutions to ensure the integrity, accuracy, and availability of the company’s master data assets. This role collaborates with IT and business stakeholders to establish governance and standards for data management.

This position will be inclusive of proactively triaging events cross-functional to minimize delays and ensuring we exhaust all options prior to changing patient dose date. The individual will collaborate with various cross-functional business partners and utilize an Enterprise Resource Planning system (SAP) and digital platforms as sources of trusted data for communication and decision making.

This role will support the Finite Scheduling team to collect and drive patient escalation issues, ensuring the timely disposition of products and maintain a centralized schedule to support Manufacturing.

This role will closely partner with the Patient Interface Team, communicating schedule challenges and risks to meeting patient dose schedule.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Develop and execute the master data management strategy and roadmap in alignment with organizational goals.

  • Oversee the INT design, implementation, and maintenance of MDM systems and architecture.

  • Collaborate with LCM, IT, and business stakeholders to identify critical data elements and define data ownership.

  • Monitor the effectiveness of data management practices and make recommendations for improvements.

  • Foster a data-centric culture within the organization and advocate for the importance of high-quality master data.

  • Report on the status of MDM efforts and their impact on business operations to senior leadership.

  • Develop and maintain the master data management strategy in line with INT business objectives and IT architecture.

  • Define and implement data governance policies, standards, and procedures.

  • Initiate the creation and maintenance of master data records across the organization.

  • Ensure data quality by implementing quality checks, controls, and periodic audits.

  • Collaborate with various departments to understand data usage and implications for data governance.

  • Ensure compliance with data management policies.

  • Facilitate the resolution of data quality issues through the appropriate choice of error detection and correction, process control and improvement, or process design strategies.

  • Manage and enhance the organization's data technology platforms to support master data management.

  • Drive continuous improvement in data management practices.

  • Serve as the liaison between business and IT to ensure that data related business requirements are clearly defined and communicated.

  • Additional duties as may be assigned from time to time

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Management, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data management.

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Proven experience in developing and implementing MDM strategies and systems.

  • Strong understanding of data governance principles and practices.

  • Excellent team management skills.

  • Strong project management, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.

  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Experience with leading MDM platforms like Informatica MDM, SAP MDG, or Oracle MDM.

  • Knowledge of industry-specific data standards and regulations· Strong understanding of SAP Master Data Management and financial process

Job Title: Associate Director, CDO Clinical Financial Planning
Job Description:
Job Description

The Role:

Reporting to the Director, CDO Business Analytics & Operations Management, the Associate Director, CDO Clinical Financial Planning will collaborate cross-functionally on the development and implementation of cost management tools and processes within Clinical Development Operations (CDO). The ideal candidate will bring experience in analyzing and reporting clinical trial financial data, with a primary focus on clinical trial costing, scenario planning, and exploring trial optionality.

This role is pivotal in rapidly driving financial decision making and requires a candidate who is highly analytical, detail-oriented, and has a knack for transforming complex data into actionable insights. The successful candidate will have a proven ability to communicate complex financial information to diverse teams and stakeholders, and to collaborate effectively across the organization.

This position will also play a key role in clinical study financial risk management and process improvement. They are expected to identify and advise study teams on financial risks and impact to budget, continuously enhance study financial planning processes, ensure compliance with standards and internal processes and procedures, and provide training and guidance on financial planning related to clinical trials.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

  • Ensure accuracy of clinical trial budgets and forecasting, including modeling clinical study spend and supporting or developing system to support cost models with related assumptions

  • Develop, implement, and support financial planning tools and models focused on costing clinical trials and identifying cost-efficient options

  • Facilitate predictive analytics related to the cost of clinical trials, enabling rapid decision-making and efficiency

  • Collaborate with key stakeholders to transform business questions and data into cost-effective solutions for clinical trials

  • Lead initiatives and projects related to Clinical Financial Planning, ensuring solutions are scalable and follow best practices

  • Deliver accurate, innovative, and timely insights (ex. creation of dashboards and monthly reports providing transparency into clinical trial costs and trends)

  • Collaborate with CDO functions and R&D Finance to establish best practices, processes, and training for the financial planning of clinical trials

  • Provide subject matter expertise to teams on financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting related to clinical trials

  • Support teams in generating data around costing to allow for a financial assessment and impact for new studies, programs, and/or amendments to existing studies

  • Identify potential financial risks for clinical trials and propose mitigation strategies

  • Continuously evaluate and improve the planning process and systems used within role to increase efficiency and accuracy

  • Provide input as needed to financial aspects of contracts and agreements with third party vendors providing services on clinical trials

  • Liaise between R&D finance and CDO to ensure alignment and understanding of financial data on clinical trials

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

  • BA/BS required, advanced degree preferred

  • Minimum of 10+ years of experience in a clinical research environment within the pharmaceutical, CRO and biotech industry

  • Minimum of 7+ years of direct experience in clinical trial financial planning, reporting, and analysis

  • Proficiency in financial modeling and forecasting, with a strong understanding of financial systems and databases

  • Experience with ClearTrial or similar software/tools preferred

  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, with a demonstrated ability to transform complex data into actionable insights

  • Record of establishing effective business relationships with internal and external customers, demonstrating strong collaboration skills, commitment to relationship building, and a relentless focus on delivering on commitments

  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional matrix environment

  • Effective communication skills, with the ability to explain complex financial information to non-financial stakeholders

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

Moderna continues to leverage its novel mRNA platform to expand the R&D portfolio and open new therapeutic applications for mRNA across diseases and therapeutic areas. R&D Strategy plays a crucial role for Moderna to achieve its mission to deliver the greatest possible impact to people through mRNA medicines by supporting critical research and development decisions.

The R&D Strategy team operates across research and development to provide analysis and guidance from discovery through development. The team executes a portfolio of strategy projects comprised of:

  • Discovery strategy to provide a scientific and business assessment of discovery concepts and novel applications of mRNA

  • Program strategy to drive research, preclinical and clinical development decision-making for specific programs

  • Portfolio strategy to set R&D priorities and objectives

The Senior Director, R&D Strategy will be responsible for a collection of strategy projects focused around one or more key pillars of R&D and enterprise strategy (e.g., respiratory vaccines, cancer vaccines, rare metabolic therapies, next generation pipeline and platform). This person will act as a critical integrator across the R&D portfolio to identify and drive towards R&D value catalysts through prioritization and sequencing of programs and resources.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Generate, prioritize and advance an agenda of discovery, program and portfolio strategy projects: deliver and action the most complex and cross-functional R&D questions

  • Discovery Strategy: In partnership with research leadership, identify novel mRNA applications and modalities through integrated assessment of biological, clinical and market factors

  • Program Strategy: In collaboration with program leadership, drive integrated discovery, preclinical, early-development and development strategy. Influence program strategy to align with the integrated R&D Strategy; identify and advance portfolio value catalysts

  • Portfolio Strategy: Integrate portfolio and program perspectives into enterprise strategy, contributing to long-range planning, objective setting, and portfolio prioritization

  • Be a trusted advisor and thought partner for Program Leadership and the R&D Leadership Team

  • Maintain an enterprise view across research, development, manufacturing and commercial

Job Title: Sr. Clinical Trial Manager, Clinical Operations, Infectious Disease
Job Description:
Job Description

The Role:

The Sr. Clinical Trial Manager (Sr. CTM) provides clinical trial oversight to the assigned clinical trial(s), which may be complex or high priority, and ensures deliverables are met in terms of quality, compliance and timing. Strong vendor management is critical for this role. external vendors and CROs.The position may report to the Director, Clinical Operations.This role may work collaboratively on one trial or across several trials to support clinical operations activities.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

  • Perform day to day management and oversight of assigned clinical trial(s) to ensure deliverables are met in all phases of trial

  • Lead the Clinical Trial Team, and support other development teams as a Clinical Operations representative as required

  • Perform and document study level Sponsor Oversight of outsourced clinical activities

  • Communicate study-status, cost and issues to ensure timely decision-making by senior management

  • Initiate and manage study-level timelines, including communication to internal and external team members on deliverables

  • Work closely with other supporting clinical operations team members, if applicable, to execute clinical studies

  • Draft and/or oversee the drafting of site materials including training, manuals and support documentation

  • Review clinical data to ensure timely entry and readiness for data review meetings

  • Perform periodic review of clinical data, quality metrics and study deviations

  • Manage trial feasibility process and oversee site feasibility/capability assessments in collaboration with the CRO and cross-functional team

  • Review and provide clinical operations input into relevant clinical documents such as the protocol, investigator brochure, regulatory documents, clinical study reports and other documents and plans as appropriate

  • Review clinical monitoring reports to ensure timely completion and identification of issues

  • Ensure trial samples are ready to be sent to vendors in order to meet trial deliverables

  • Complete and maintain internal clinical trial metrics, dashboards and other internal updates

  • Ensure trial is conducted in accordance with Moderna and ICH/GCP standards including multiple regions in global trials

  • Participate in testing of clinical trial systems/databases (i.e. UAT)

  • Manage invoice and budget tracking for individual studies and provide input into budget forecasting activities

  • May support additional clinical trial(s) in various capacities (e.g., unblinded clinical trial manager, regional clinical trial manager, etc.)

  • Participate in clinical operations workstreams related to departmental and operating model related initiatives Develop and maintain strong, collaborative relationships with key stakeholders within and external to Moderna

  • Strive for continuous improvement and more efficient ways of working in clinical development

  • Act as a role model for Moderna’s values

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

  • 5-7 years of experience in a clinical research and industry environment, including a minimum of 2+ years of independent trial management preferred

  • Bachelor’s degree required; Advanced degree preferred

  • Relevant experience in global setting, across more than one phase of development, and across entire lifecycle of a study

  • Solid understanding of drug development

  • Good project management skills

  • Good understanding of FDA and ICH GCP guidelines to ensure the appropriate conduct of clinical studies

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Good organizational skills and attention to detail

The Role:

Moderna Therapeutics is seeking a Sr. Manager of Regulatory Strategy based in Cambridge headquarters. This is a newly created role intended for a forward looking, creative and agile regulatory manager able to anticipate and address the challenges involved in gaining market approval for messenger RNA therapeutics as unprecedented new drug modality. The Sr. Manager will provide regulatory support for Oncology. Their support includes but is not limited to managing the submissions and approvals of INDs, marketing applications, and other regulatory submissions (orphan drug designations, pediatric plans, PRIME, BTD applications, DSURs, MAA/BLA/NDA, etc.)

  • Works with RA-Strategist and project teams regarding the development and execution of regulatory strategy through the clinical development processes.

  • Responsible for coordinating aspects of regulatory submissions relevant to assigned projects or programs.

  • Contact regulatory agencies relevant to assigned projects or programs, as appropriate.

  • Contribute, maintain the Core Data Sheet and support global labeling team meetings.

  • Ability to work both independently and within project teams, committees, etc. to achieve group goals.

  • BA/BS degree in a scientific/engineering/healthcare discipline required, Masters, PharmD or PhD preferred.

  • 5+ years of experience in the Pharmaceutical industry preferred

  • 3+ years of experience in Regulatory strategy or relevant training/experience preferred

  • Experience in Oncology is strongly preferred

  • Strong knowledge of current US and EU regulations

  • Strong experience with CTD format and content of regulatory filings

  • Exceptional written and oral communication

  • Experience with developing and implementing gap analysis and related competitive regulatory strategies

  • Knowledge of and broad experience with regulatory procedures and legislation for drug development, product registration, line extension and license maintenance--preferably from at least both US and EU

  • Demonstrate strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize workload.

  • Experience and knowledge in the preparation of major regulatory submissions and supportive amendments or supplements.

  • Knowledge and understanding of applicable regulations.

  • Experience in interpretation of regulations, guidelines, policy statements, etc.

  • Experience working on products in development specifically relating to clinical and pre-clinical regulatory aspects of the project.

Job Description:
Job Description

The Role

Moderna is seeking a QC Equipment Associate with strong foundation in laboratory equipment operation, calibration, maintenance, and troubleshooting skills. The candidate will be supporting the quality control equipment and instrumentation utilized in laboratory operations by coordinating laboratory equipment acquisition, qualification, calibration, and preventative maintenance. The QC Equipment Associate is expected to work on routine tasks and have a strong foundation in QC functions and business areas. He/She must have demonstrated solid scientific and technical breadth to support laboratory equipment life cycle management at Moderna. He/She will serve as a runner for the QC Equipment team across multiple sites and departments. The candidate will also support deviation, investigation, change control, corrective actions, and preventive actions (CAPAs) related to QC equipment. This role is on-site first shift, Monday to Friday.

Here’s What You’ll Do:

As part of the QC Equipment team, your primary responsibilities will be as follows:

  • Equipment life cycle management for QC, AS&T and INT departments (e.g. Chemistry, Bioassay, Microbiology, Raw materials, Sample Management, etc.), which may include, but not limited to pH, Balance, KF, Osmometer, HPLC/UPLC, GC, LC-MS, Sequencer, PCR, Thermocycler, Cell Viability Analyzer, Sterility Isolators, TOC, Pyros Kinetix Flex tube reader, Microbial Identification System, Autoclave, Depyrogenation Oven, Air Samplers, Particle Counter, Bioanalyzer, Hygrometer, CTU, Incubator, BSC, LFH, etc.

  • Support team to investigate and resolve issues related to equipment failures, system deficiencies, deviations, and equipment troubleshooting.

  • Support authoring quality systems records such as deviations, change controls, CAPAs, OOTs (Out of Tolerance) as required.

  • Support on-site QC Equipment team activities.

  • Ordering equipment, supplies, and maintaining inventory for equipment consumables/accessories.

  • CTU alarm response, calibration and re-qualification coordinating and scheduling.

  • Assist with locating and collecting assets due for service and returning to laboratory when complete.

  • Serve as point person in QC for all equipment inquiries and relay to appropriate vendors onsite and externally.

  • Escort and support vendors as needed to ensure timely closure of work request.

  • Support QC Equipment team with as-needed non-invasive repairs and basic troubleshooting , e.g.,  changing capillaries, flow cells, needles/seats. For UPLC systems

  • Coordinate and schedule calibration/maintenance activities with Facilities, Metrology, and QC to ensure timely completion and minimize equipment down time.

  • Review of preventative maintenance reports, calibration certifications, CMMS records, and perform system inventory audits in enterprise software

  • Support equipment lifecycle projects with guidance.

  • Attending cross-functional meetings.

  • Participate inspection readiness projects

  • Follow safety guidelines when working in laboratory setting

  • Other responsibilities to support team projects and proactive initiatives.

Here’s What You’ll Need (Minimum Qualifications)

  • Minimum education required: Bachelor’s degree in sciences and 2-5 years of industry experience in a cGMP laboratory setting

  • QC Experience 2 years (preferred)

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table:

  • Proficiency with Smartsheet and Microsoft office

  • Familiar with Chromeleon, Maximo or equivalent software (preferred)

  • Strong collaboration and organization skills

  • Capability to make decisions under pressure and escalate issues as needed

  • Desire to learn equipment lifecycle management

  • An understanding of GMP/GDP/QC Data interpretation and strong attention to details

  • Experience in operating various equipment in a QC setting

  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written)

  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a dynamic, cross-functional matrix environment (QC, QA, Validation, Digital, Vendors) to ensure equipment and digital projects meet timelines

  • Ability to efficiently prioritize and complete multiple projects and tasks in a fast-paced environment

  • Details and results oriented

  • Outstanding ability to multi-task

  • Strong sense of urgency

  • Ownership to the projects and commitment to meet the timelines

  • Solid knowledge of lab safety

  • A desire to make an impact as part of a high-growth, transformational company that is Bold, Relentless, Curious, and Collaborative.

  • This position is site-based, requiring you to be at Moderna’s site full-time. This position is not eligible for remote work.

Job Description

The Role

In this role, you will be part of a cohesive team responsible for producing high quality mRNA-based medicines for production specializing in Moderna’s Individualized Neoantigen Therapy.  uses expert knowledge of cGMP regulations and biopharmaceutical production processes to support projects as well as day to day operations through deviation and CAPA writing with a focus on but not limited to DNA, mRNA, or Fill Finish Operations.  The Specialist will be a key player during Marlborough operational readiness efforts by supporting startup activities, investigating issues that arise, and driving projects within the team focused on delivering results in an efficient manner. This position will be M-F, with occasional tasks outside working hours to support 24/7 operations.

Here’s What You’ll Do

  • Practice and promote safe work habits and adheres to safety procedures and guidelines

  • Utilize manufacturing process knowledge and investigational skills to identify and resolve manufacturing issues, deviations, non-conformances, and unexpected events

  • Lead cross functional teams to drive complex investigation close outs, determine root causes and implement appropriate corrective and preventive actions (CAPA)

  • Conduct document revisions and/or document management including batch production records and manufacturing procedures

  • Participate in additional user forums for gathering ongoing requirements and prioritization and triage issues

  • Follow-up on requests, issues, and projects and report statuses to manager/ working teams

  • May perform metric trending

  • May generate technical protocols and reports

  • May support internal and external audits

  • Work independently with minimal supervision and direction

  • Additional duties as may be assigned from time to time

Here’s What You’ll Need ( Basic Qualifications)

  • Bachelor's Degree with 5+ years of experience in biopharmaceutical operations or a Master’s Degree with 2-5 years industry experience; Degree in Engineering or Life Sciences is preferred

Here’s What You’ll Bring to the Table (Preferred Qualifications)

  • Subject matter expertise in biologics drug substance purification operations (liquid chromatography, TFF, aseptic technique), drug product operations or a similar complex specialized environment

  • Understanding of investigational techniques such as Fishbone/Ishikawa analysis, 5-Why, Kepner Tregoe

  • A comprehensive understanding of regulatory requirements and their applications in a cGMP environment

  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience with Quality management systems or a similar technical writing system in a cGMP environment

  • Excellent written and oral English language skills

  • Demonstrated ability to lead cross functional teams and deliver results with minimal supervision

  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

  • Experience working with electronic batch records and thorough understanding of 21 CFR part 11 requirements

  • Experience interacting with representatives of regulatory agencies
